comments.body: This recipe should be `noarch`, so please add `noarch: python` back.

I think `noarch` doesn't work here because of the entry point that the `setup.py` defines. On Windows a binary named xdoctest.exe is created, see https://dev.azure.com/conda-forge/feedstock-builds/_build/results?buildId=124314&view=logs&j=240f1fee-52bc-5498-a14a-8361bde76ba0&t=78a0099b-3f13-5ae9-c1f0-24f71d1eac20&l=787
Nevermind, `noarch` seems to work after all if I explicitly define the entry point in the recipe.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +15,19 @@  entry_points:
    - xdoctest = xdoctest.__main__:main
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
